JAMES ETHERIDGE
E-TV AND PUBLIC AFFAIRS CONSULTANT
903 WASHINGTON STREET
TALLAHASSEE, FLORIDA
32303
7 April 1965
Mr. Harold Hill, Administrative Vice President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
DuPont Circle Building
Washington 36, D. C.
Dear Harold:
Thank you for your letter advising that the entire Region
II is illegitimate -- in action taken at the Williamsburg Conference
to set up something of an "Executive Committee".
First, this is a recommendation for which I -- not John
Young or anyone else -- was responsible. John simply presented
my recommendation.
Secondly, I did not have in mind an organizational set-up
of the formal nature for which the NAEB Constitution and By-Laws
provide -- though, of course, there's no reason why it should not
be made formal and in full accord with NAEB Constitutional law.
While my wife's serious illness is quite extended, you may
be sure that I will, at the earliest appropriate time, gather with
all Region II officials involved and move to comply in every respect
with the type of organization called for, and by bulletin notify
all Region II members that we are indeed "legit". We will also
confirm site and Conference Chairman for 1966.
I look forward with pleasure as always to seeing you and
Bill and all colleagues in Columbus May 31, if not sooner.
Thank you, and best personal regards always
Sincerely,
